page.title: 06A Burgess Hill Country Park
page.content: { Ditchling Common Country Park}was opened by East Sussex County Council in 1974. It covers 188 acres. In the park there is a lake with fish in it. Quite a few people fish there and catch{carp, tench, roach, pike, {perch, minnow,}etc.. The bait used is normally small pieces of bread or maggots, but some people use seeds or sweetcorn. In Summer{dragonflies}and{damselflies fly over the water. You might see one of the largest dragonflies in Britain, the deep blue and green{Emperor. On the Common, around the lake, there are quite a few{footpaths and {bridleways.}Some footpaths lead to fields and small clearings, where people have picnics.
